basics.name: Laurent MacKay
basics.label: Mathematical Physiologist
basics.summary: A Canadian mathematical physiologist with a background in biophysics and a passion for nonlinear dynamics.

work.name: Deptartment of Mathematics, University of British Columbia
work.summary: Used high-performance computing methods to study phenonmena in developmental biology. Also taught calculus and differential equations to science and engineering students.
highlights: Applied Mathematics, ODEs, PDEs, Dynamical Systems

courses: Key Skills: Nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, data analysis pipelines, machine learning.
Thesis: Modelling the dynamics of cellular motililty, from adhesion dynamics to cellular migration.

Courses: Active Mechanics in Biology; Respiratory, Renal, & Cardiovascular Physiology; Blood, Gastrointestinal, & Immune System Physiology; Analyzing Physiological Systems; Numerical Analysis I; Numerical Differential Equations.
Key Skills: Numerical ODE solvers, Bayesian inference (MCMC), data fitting.
Thesis: Deciphering the allosteric modulation of the purinergic P2X receptors using Markov models.
Courses: Biomedical Signals & Systems; Topics in PDEs; Biophysics; Stochastic Processes.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
